topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Brandon Chu, his role at Shopify, and the areas they’ll cover (Shopify product culture, remote work, writing, PM career topics).

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Stytch (authentication/onboarding) and Persona (identity/KYC/AML).

topics.title: Childhood dream: becoming an astronaut
topics.summary: Brandon shares his long-term plan to go to space, including saving and investing annually to afford it, and discusses how costs are trending closer to feasible.

topics.title: Career journey into product and Shopify
topics.summary: Brandon recounts moving from finance to co-founding a startup (Tunezy), learning PM through startup work and FreshBooks, then joining Shopify during IPO week and growing into VP roles.

topics.title: Skills behind rapid PM career trajectory
topics.summary: Brandon explains that beyond PM hard skills and domain expertise, the biggest accelerators are “founder skills”: storytelling, motivating teams, high-conviction decisions under ambiguity, and accountability.

topics.title: Shopify product culture and operating principles
topics.summary: They discuss Shopify’s technical roots, shared responsibility for product thinking across functions, and a founder-heavy PM org; Brandon summarizes the PM job as helping teams ship the right thing at the right time in the right way.

topics.title: Decision-making power across PM seniority levels
topics.summary: Brandon describes how junior PMs emphasize balanced cross-functional decisions, while directors/VPs must set strategy and make calls, creating tension as company context and roles evolve.

topics.title: Planning at Shopify: investment plans and agility
topics.summary: Brandon outlines annual investment plans that set broad direction, followed by decentralized execution and frequent reprioritization; Shopify avoids sunk-cost fallacy and changes course when reality shifts.

topics.title: COVID wartime shift and rapid reprioritization
topics.summary: They cover how Shopify scrapped roadmaps to focus on urgent merchant survival needs (e.g., curbside pickup, gift cards), with leadership deeply involved and a narrowed set of priorities for much of 2020.

topics.title: Remote work lessons: bursts and work-from-anywhere
topics.summary: Brandon explains Shopify’s remote-by-default approach, emphasizing periodic in-person “bursts,” streamlined logistics via internal tooling, and policies enabling global mobility to turn remote constraints into advantages.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for PostHog (open-source product analytics suite with funnels, heatmaps, session recording, experimentation, and warehouse integrations).

topics.title: Burst tooling details and travel booking mechanics
topics.summary: They dig into how Shopify’s burst system works (locations, office retrofits, ratings, participation data) and briefly discuss how flight/hotel booking likely integrates via TripActions APIs.

topics.title: Writing process: how Brandon produced high-quality posts
topics.summary: Brandon shares that writing helped him discover what he thought in real time; he describes investing ~40 hours per post, heavy editing, and seeking early feedback to sharpen narrative and clarity.

topics.title: Why PMs should write and career impact
topics.summary: They argue writing improves clarity even if not published; Brandon explains how his posts boosted internal trust, onboarded teammates faster, aided recruiting, and accelerated his career—while also creating pressure that contributed to stopping.

topics.title: Favorite post: decision importance and fast delegation
topics.summary: Brandon highlights his decision-making framework: first assess decision importance, spend time on the few irreversible/high-impact calls, and move quickly (gut/delegate) on the rest to maintain velocity.

topics.title: Platform PM: what he wants to write next
topics.summary: Brandon previews a long-form piece on platform PM work: multi-constituent tradeoffs, policy/data tensions, economic incentives, and deep integration design choices (iframes vs native surfaces, extensions, APIs).

topics.title: Platform PM frameworks: psychology and principles
topics.summary: Brandon shares rules of thumb for platform PMs: expect longer feedback cycles, celebrate intermediate milestones, and define platform principles/constituent priorities early to guide policy and design decisions and avoid late-stage blowups.
